short_desc: Domestic violence shelter for women and children. Includes lesbian and transgender survivors living their lives as women. Serves primarily Dublin, Pleasanton, Livermore
description: Houses and supports women and children that are victims of domestic violence. Length of stay is up to 105 days (approximately 3-1/2 months), with weekly evaluations. Situated in a safe and confidential location. Provides emergency food, clothing, and personal items. Each resident is assigned a counselor who works individually during counseling sessions, and a case manager to assist in meeting housing, legal, vocational, and financial needs.Also serves lesbian survivors of intimate partner violence and transgender survivors who are living their lives as women.Does not provide transportation to shelter (no pick up, no tax voucher, etc). Only provides transportation assistance to shelter residents for essential medical appointments.Families must purchase and prepare own meals (can purchase from Agency's food pantry).Each resident can bring two bags of personal belongings per person.
